query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 «Osanna, sanctus Deus sabaòth, 2 superillustrans claritate tua 3 felices ignes horum malacòth!».
query.error: **English:** 1 "Hosanna, holy God of hosts, 2 supremely illuminating with your brightness 3 the blessed fires of these heavens!".
query.result: 1 "Osanna, devaḥ śuddhaḥ sarvavyāpī, 2 tava prakāśena atiśayena prakāśamānāḥ, 3 ayam svargalokaḥ sukhamānasāḥ!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Così, volgendosi a la nota sua, 5 fu viso a me cantare essa sustanza, 6 sopra la qual doppio lume s’addua;
query.error: **English:** 4 Thus, turning to her guide, 5 that substance began to sing to me, 6 upon which two lights were shining;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 ed essa e l’altre mossero a sua danza, 8 e quasi velocissime faville 9 mi si velar di sùbita distanza.
query.error: **English:** 7 and she and the others moved in their dance, 8 and like the swiftest sparks 9 they veiled themselves from me with sudden distance.
query.result: 7 sā ca anyāś ca svakīye nṛtye pravṛttāḥ, 8 caṇḍavegena pradiptā iva agniśikhāḥ, 9 āścaryeṇa atiśayena dūratayā mama prati āvaraṇam cakruḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Io dubitava e dicea ‘Dille, dille!’ 11 fra me, ‘dille’ dicea, ‘a la mia donna 12 che mi diseta con le dolci stille’.
query.error: **English:** 10 I hesitated and said, ‘Speak, speak!’ 11 to myself, ‘speak’ I said, ‘to my lady 12 who used to guide me with her sweet words’.
query.result: 10 Ahaṃ saṃdigdhas tathāhaṃ ‘Bruhi, bruhi!’ 11 ‘Bruhi’ iti ahaṃ ‘mama svāminīṃ prati, 12 Yā mama madhuraiḥ padaiḥ upadesam dadāti’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Ma quella reverenza che s’indonna 14 di tutto me, pur per Be e per ice, 15 mi richinava come l’uom ch’assonna.
query.error: **English:** 13 But that reverence which was instilled in me 14 by all of me, even for Beatrice and for poetry, 15 urged me on like a man who has just woken up.
query.result: 13 Api tu sā śraddhā yā mayi prādurbabhūva 14 Mama sarvasyaiva, kim tu Beatrices tathā kāvyasya nimittam, 15 Mām āhūya ānayad yathā nidrāluḥ puruṣaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Poco sofferse me cotal Beatrice 17 e cominciò, raggiandomi d’un riso 18 tal, che nel foco faria l’uom felice:
query.error: **English:** 16 Beatrice suffered me thus for a short while, 17 and then began, beaming at me with a smile 18 that would make a man happy even in the fire:
query.result: 16 Alpaṃ kālaṃ mām evam adhivāsayatīṃ Beatricī 17 Ārabdhāvāca hasantī mama mukham abhimukham ābhāsya 18 Tādṛśena hasitena yena agnau api puruṣaḥ sukham anubhavati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 «Secondo mio infallibile avviso, 20 come giusta vendetta giustamente 21 punita fosse, t’ha in pensier miso;
query.error: **English:** 19 "According to my infallible judgment, 20 you have been troubled by the thought of how justly 21 a just vengeance was punished;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 ma io ti solverò tosto la mente; 23 e tu ascolta, ché le mie parole 24 di gran sentenza ti faran presente.
query.error: **English:** 22 but I will quickly free your mind; 23 and you, listen, for my words 24 will reveal to you a great truth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Per non soffrire a la virtù che vole 26 freno a suo prode, quell’ uom che non nacque, 27 dannando sé, dannò tutta sua prole;
query.error: **English:** 25 In order not to submit to the virtue that desires 26 a bridle for his own good, that man who was not born, 27 condemning himself, condemned all his offspring;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 onde l’umana specie inferma giacque 29 giù per secoli molti in grande errore, 30 fin ch’al Verbo di Dio discender piacque
query.error: **English:** 28 whence the infirm human race lay 29 down through many centuries in great error, 30 until it pleased the Word of God to descend
query.result: 28 yatas tasmāt kāraṇāt manuṣyāṇām jātiḥ durbalā 29 adhastāt bahūn śatakān bahuṣu moheṣu nyapatat, 30 yāvat na Bhagavataḥ śabdasya avataraṇam abhavat rocate sma

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 u’ la natura, che dal suo fattore 32 s’era allungata, unì a sé in persona 33 con l’atto sol del suo etterno amore.
query.error: **English:** 31 where nature, which had separated itself from its Creator, 32 united itself to Him in person 33 with the sole act of His eternal love.
query.result: 31 yatra prakṛtiḥ, yā svakīyāt kartṛṇaḥ 32 viyukta āsid, sa svayam eva ātmanā saha ekatvam prāptavān, 33 kevalam svakīyasya nityasya premaṇaḥ prayogena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Or drizza il viso a quel ch’or si ragiona: 35 questa natura al suo fattore unita, 36 qual fu creata, fu sincera e buona;
query.error: **English:** 34 Now turn your face to what is being spoken of: 35 this nature, united to its creator, 36 as it was created, was pure and good;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 ma per sé stessa pur fu ella sbandita 38 di paradiso, però che si torse 39 da via di verità e da sua vita.
query.error: **English:** 37 but by itself it was banished 38 from paradise, because it turned away 39 from the path of truth and from its life.
query.result: 37 svata eva tu sā svargāt vinirvāsitā, 38 yataḥ satyamargaj jīvanācca vivikta, 39 pravṛttā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 La pena dunque che la croce porse 41 s’a la natura assunta si misura, 42 nulla già mai sì giustamente morse;
query.error: **English:** 40 Therefore, the suffering that the cross inflicted, 41 if measured against the nature that it assumed, 42 never was anything so justly punished;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 e così nulla fu di tanta ingiura, 44 guardando a la persona che sofferse, 45 in che era contratta tal natura.
query.error: **English:** 43 and so nothing was ever so wronged, 44 considering the person who suffered, 45 in whom such a nature was contracted.
query.result: 43 evam ca na kiṃcid evaṃ bahv-aparādhaṃ babhūva, 44 yadi vyathitāyai vyaktaye avalokitaṃ syāt, 45 yasminn evamrūpā prakṛtiḥ samāveśitā āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Però d’un atto uscir cose diverse: 47 ch’a Dio e a’ Giudei piacque una morte; 48 per lei tremò la terra e ’l ciel s’aperse.
query.error: **English:** 46 But from one deed diverse things proceed: 47 for God and the Jews one death was pleasing; 48 because of it the earth trembled and the heavens opened.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Non ti dee oramai parer più forte, 50 quando si dice che giusta vendetta 51 poscia vengiata fu da giusta corte.
query.error: **English:** 49 It should not seem too bold to you now, 50 when it is said that just vengeance 51 was later avenged by a just court.
query.result: 49 Na tvām idānīm adhikaṃ śobhate, 50 yadā ucyate yathā nyāyyā pratiśodhanā 51 paścād nyāyyena nyāyālayena pratikṛtā abhūt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Ma io veggi’ or la tua mente ristretta 53 di pensiero in pensier dentro ad un nodo, 54 del qual con gran disio solver s’aspetta.
query.error: **English:** 52 But now I see your mind is tightly bound 53 from thought to thought within a knot, 54 which you long to untie with great desire.
query.result: 52 Atha tvām adya paśyāmi cittam samkucitam 53 cintāyāṃ cintāyāṃ granthibhūtam, 54 yasya granthasya mocanam atiprārthanīyam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Tu dici: “Ben discerno ciò ch’i’ odo; 56 ma perché Dio volesse, m’è occulto, 57 a nostra redenzion pur questo modo”.
query.error: **English:** 55 You say: "I understand well what I hear; 56 but why God willed it, is hidden from me, 57 for our redemption, even in this way".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Questo decreto, frate, sta sepulto 59 a li occhi di ciascuno il cui ingegno 60 ne la fiamma d’amor non è adulto.
query.error: **English:** 58 This decree, brother, remains hidden 59 to the eyes of everyone whose intellect 60 is not mature in the flame of love.
query.result: 58 Ayaṃ vidhiḥ, bhrātar, sthitaḥ guhyataḥ 59 Sarvasya janasya yasya buddhiḥ 60 Na praudhaḥ asti prema-jvalane.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Veramente, però ch’a questo segno 62 molto si mira e poco si discerne, 63 dirò perché tal modo fu più degno.
query.error: **English:** 61 Truly, however, at this point 62 one looks much and discerns little, 63 I will tell why such a way was more worthy.
query.result: 61 Tathāpi, yadyapi ayam arthaḥ 62 atiśayam avalokyate, alpam tu vijñāyate, 63 vakṣyāmi kena ayam mārgaḥ adhikaḥ śobhanaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 La divina bontà, che da sé sperne 65 ogne livore, ardendo in sé, sfavilla 66 sì che dispiega le bellezze etterne.
query.error: **English:** 64 The divine goodness, which scorns 65 all ill-will, burning within itself, 66 so that it displays the eternal beauties.
query.result: 64 Daivikopaniṣat, yā svata eva 65 sarvam dveṣam parityajati, svayam eva dīpyamānā, 66 tathā prakāśayati nityāni saundaryāṇi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Ciò che da lei sanza mezzo distilla 68 non ha poi fine, perché non si move 69 la sua imprenta quand’ ella sigilla.
query.error: **English:** 67 That which distills from her without a medium 68 has no end, because her imprint does not move 69 when she seals it.
query.result: 67 Yattasyāḥ vinā madhyamam sravati 68 Na tasya antaḥ asti, yataḥ na calati 69 Tasyāḥ mudrā yadā mudrayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ciò che da essa sanza mezzo piove 71 libero è tutto, perché non soggiace 72 a la virtute de le cose nove.
query.error: **English:** 70 That which rains down from it without a medium 71 is free in every way, because it is not subject 72 to the power of new things.
query.result: 70 Yat tena anantarīyāt pravarṣati 71 tat sarvam eva svātantryeṇa vartate, yataḥ na tad adhīnam bhavati 72 navānāṃ vastūnāṃ śaktaye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Più l’è conforme, e però più le piace; 74 ché l’ardor santo ch’ogne cosa raggia, 75 ne la più somigliante è più vivace.
query.error: **English:** 73 The more it conforms, the more it pleases her; 74 for the holy ardor that illumines everything 75 is more vivid in that which is most like it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Di tutte queste dote s’avvantaggia 77 l’umana creatura, e s’una manca, 78 di sua nobilità convien che caggia.
query.error: **English:** 76 Of all these gifts the human creature is endowed 77 and if one is lacking, 78 it is necessary that it fall from its nobility.
query.result: 76 Sarvāṇi etāni guṇāḥ santi 77 manuṣyeṇa, yadi ekaḥ api na bhavati, 78 tadā tasya utkarṣaḥ na bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Solo il peccato è quel che la disfranca 80 e falla dissimìle al sommo bene, 81 per che del lume suo poco s’imbianca;
query.error: **English:** 79 Only sin is that which disfranchises her 80 and makes her unlike the supreme good, 81 because she is illumined but little by its light;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 e in sua dignità mai non rivene, 83 se non rïempie, dove colpa vòta, 84 contra mal dilettar con giuste pene.
query.error: **English:** 82 and she never attains her dignity again, 83 unless she fills up, where fault empties, 84 with just penalties the delight in evil.
query.result: 82 ca svakīye māne na kadācid āpnoti, 83 yadi na pūrayati, yatra doṣaḥ śūnyatām āpnoti, 84 mithyāsukhaṃ nyāyyaiḥ daṇḍaiḥ prati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Vostra natura, quando peccò tota 86 nel seme suo, da queste dignitadi, 87 come di paradiso, fu remota;
query.error: **English:** 85 Your nature, when it sinned totally 86 in its seed, was removed from these dignities, 87 as from paradise,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 né ricovrar potiensi, se tu badi 89 ben sottilmente, per alcuna via, 90 sanza passar per un di questi guadi:
query.error: **English:** 88 nor could it recover them, if you consider 89 subtly enough, by any way, 90 without passing through one of these fords:
query.result: 88 na ca prāptuṃ śakyate, yadi tvam paśyasi 89 ati sūkṣmeṇa, kena api mārgeṇa, 90 anena vā tena vā gādha-jalena anantaram kṛtvā:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 o che Dio solo per sua cortesia 92 dimesso avesse, o che l’uom per sé isso 93 avesse sodisfatto a sua follia.
query.error: **English:** 91 either that God alone through his courtesy 92 had remitted, or that man by himself 93 had made satisfaction for his folly.
query.result: 91 vā yadi Bhagavān eva sva-dayayā 92 muñcet, vā yadi naraḥ svayam eva 93 prāyaścittam kuryāt sva-mūḍhatāyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Ficca mo l’occhio per entro l’abisso 95 de l’etterno consiglio, quanto puoi 96 al mio parlar distrettamente fisso.
query.error: **English:** 94 Now fix your gaze into the abyss 95 of the eternal counsel, as much as you can, 96 with your attention firmly fixed on my words.
query.result: 94 Idānīm cakṣuḥ prakṣiptavyam antarenaiva 95 nityasya mantrasya, yāvat śakyate, 96 mama vākye dṛṣṭim niyatya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Non potea l’uomo ne’ termini suoi 98 mai sodisfar, per non potere ir giuso 99 con umiltate obedïendo poi,
query.error: **English:** 97 Man could not satisfy the divine justice 98 by himself, because he could not go down 99 with humility, obeying afterwards,
query.result: 97 Na śaknoti naraḥ svakīyeṣu paryāyeṣu 98 kadācit tṛptim āpnotiṃ na śaknoti gantum adhaḥ 99 vinayena anugṛhītavān paścāt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 quanto disobediendo intese ir suso; 101 e questa è la cagion per che l’uom fue 102 da poter sodisfar per sé dischiuso.
query.error: **English:** 100 as much as he intended to go up by disobedience; 101 and this is the reason why man was 102 enabled to satisfy for himself, being opened to grace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Dunque a Dio convenia con le vie sue 104 riparar l’omo a sua intera vita, 105 dico con l’una, o ver con amendue.
query.error: **English:** 103 Therefore it was necessary for God, with His ways, 104 to repair man to his full life, 105 I say with one, or indeed with both.
query.result: 103 Tasmāt Parameśvarasya svakīyaiḥ upayaiḥ 104 naraḥ pūrṇāyur api saṃskartavyaḥ eva, 105 ekena vā ubhayābhyām vā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Ma perché l’ovra tanto è più gradita 107 da l’operante, quanto più appresenta 108 de la bontà del core ond’ ell’ è uscita,
query.error: **English:** 106 But because the work is all the more pleasing 107 to the worker, the more it shows 108 the goodness of the heart from which it came forth,
query.result: 106 Api tu yasmāt karmaṇi bhavati adhikaḥ prītiḥ 107 karmaṇaḥ kartuḥ, yataḥ adhikaṃ prakāśate 108 hṛdayasya śubhatā yasya hṛdayāt tat niṣpannam asti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 la divina bontà che ’l mondo imprenta, 110 di proceder per tutte le sue vie, 111 a rilevarvi suso, fu contenta.
query.error: **English:** 109 the divine goodness that imprints the world, 110 was pleased to proceed through all its ways, 111 to raise you up on high.
query.result: 109 tasmāt jagat-saṃvidhātri devī śubhatā, 110 sarveṣu mārgeṣu pravartane, 111 yūyam utthāpayitum icchāṃ cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Né tra l’ultima notte e ’l primo die 113 sì alto o sì magnifico processo, 114 o per l’una o per l’altra, fu o fie:
query.error: **English:** 112 Neither between the last night and the first day 113 was there ever so lofty or magnificent a transaction, 114 either for the one or for the other, or ever will be:
query.result: 112 Na ca antye rātrau prathame vā ahani 113 Tathāvidho vā mahān vā vyavahāraḥ, 114 Ekena vā anyena vā, abhūt vā bhaviṣyati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 ché più largo fu Dio a dar sé stesso 116 per far l’uom sufficiente a rilevarsi, 117 che s’elli avesse sol da sé dimesso;
query.error: **English:** 115 for God was more generous in giving Himself 116 to make man capable of rising again, 117 than if He had merely forgiven him;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 e tutti li altri modi erano scarsi 119 a la giustizia, se ’l Figliuol di Dio 120 non fosse umilïato ad incarnarsi.
query.error: **English:** 118 and all other ways were insufficient 119 to satisfy justice, if the Son of God 120 had not humbled Himself to become incarnate.
query.result: 118 Sarve ca anye mārgaḥ āsann alpāḥ 119 Nyāyāya, yadi Deva-putraḥ 120 Na vinītaḥ syāt avatāraṇāya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Or per empierti bene ogne disio, 122 ritorno a dichiararti in alcun loco, 123 perché tu veggi lì così com’ io.
query.error: **English:** 121 Now, in order to fill you with every desire, 122 I return to tell you about a certain place, 123 so that you may see there just as I do.
query.result: 121 Ataḥ sarvakāmasya pūrṇatāyāṃ 122 Punar āgacchāmi kathayitum tava kasmimścid deśe, 123 Yathā tvam tatra paśyeḥ yathā aham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Tu dici: “Io veggio l’acqua, io veggio il foco, 125 l’aere e la terra e tutte lor misture 126 venire a corruzione, e durar poco;
query.error: **English:** 124 You say: “I see water, I see fire, 125 air and earth and all their mixtures 126 come to corruption, and last but a short while;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 e queste cose pur furon creature; 128 per che, se ciò ch’è detto è stato vero, 129 esser dovrien da corruzion sicure”.
query.error: **English:** 127 and these things were indeed created; 128 therefore, if what has been said is true, 129 they should be safe from corruption”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Li angeli, frate, e ’l paese sincero 131 nel qual tu se’, dir si posson creati, 132 sì come sono, in loro essere intero;
query.error: **English:** 130 The angels, brother, and the sincere country 131 in which you are, can be said to be created, 132 just as they are, in their entire being;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 ma li alimenti che tu hai nomati 134 e quelle cose che di lor si fanno 135 da creata virtù sono informati.
query.error: **English:** 133 but the foods that you have mentioned 134 and those things that are made from them 135 are informed by created power.
query.result: 133 ye tu āhārāḥ tvayā kathitāḥ 134 tathā ca tāni vastūni yāni tebhyaḥ kriyante 135 sṛṣṭa-śaktyā eva rūpitāni santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Creata fu la materia ch’elli hanno; 137 creata fu la virtù informante 138 in queste stelle che ’ntorno a lor vanno.
query.error: **English:** 136 The matter from which they are made was created; 137 the informing virtue was created 138 in these stars that go around them.
query.result: 136 Sṛṣṭā 'bhūt sa dravyaṃ yasmāt te sambhūtāḥ, 137 Sṛṣṭā 'bhūt sa guṇaḥ saṃviddhātā 138 Eteṣu nakṣatreṣu ye teṣāṃ paritaḥ paribhramanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 L’anima d’ogne bruto e de le piante 140 di complession potenzïata tira 141 lo raggio e ’l moto de le luci sante;
query.error: **English:** 139 The soul of every brute and of the plants 140 draws its potentiated essence 141 from the ray and motion of the holy lights;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 ma vostra vita sanza mezzo spira 143 la somma beninanza, e la innamora 144 di sé sì che poi sempre la disira.
query.error: **English:** 142 but your life is breathed into you without intermediary 143 by the supreme goodness, and it enkindles in you 144 such love for itself that you always desire it thereafter.
query.result: 142 Tvakīyam tu jīvitam tava vinā madhyastham 143 Uttamaṃ śubham ākarṣati, tatra ca 144 Tvam āsaktaḥ bhavasi yathā tad eva icchasi sadā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 E quinci puoi argomentare ancora 146 vostra resurrezion, se tu ripensi 147 come l’umana carne fessi allora
query.error: **English:** 145 And hence you can further reason 146 about your resurrection, if you think again 147 how human flesh was made then,
query.result: 145 Ata eva tvam anumātum śaknoṣi 146 tava punarutthānam, yadi punarvicintasi 147 katham mānuṣī dehaḥ abhavat tadā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 che li primi parenti intrambo fensi».
query.error: **English:** 148 when both the first parents made themselves.
query.result: 148 yadā ubhau prathamau janakau ātmānam akurutam.
